member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.AppliedTerminology.Terms
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.CreateParallelDataRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateParallelData operation. Creates a parallel data resource in Amazon Translate by importing an input file from Amazon S3. Parallel data files contain examples of source phrases and their translations from your translation memory. By adding parallel data, you can influence the style, tone, and word choice in your translation output.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ImportTerminology operation. Creates or updates a custom terminology, depending on whether or not one already exists for the given terminology name. Importing a terminology with the same name as an existing one will merge the terminologies based on the chosen merge strategy. Currently, the only supported merge strategy is OVERWRITE, and so the imported terminology will overwrite an existing terminology of the same name.
If you import a terminology that overwrites an existing one, the new terminology take up to 10 minutes to fully propagate and be available for use in a translation due to cache policies with the DataPlane service that performs the translations.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest.Description
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Description.
The description of the custom terminology being imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest.EncryptionKey
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property EncryptionKey.
The encryption key for the custom terminology being imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest.MergeStrategy
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property MergeStrategy.
The merge strategy of the custom terminology being imported. Currently, only the OVERWRITE merge strategy is supported. In this case, the imported terminology will overwrite an existing terminology of the same name.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest.Name
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Name.
The name of the custom terminology being imported.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest.TerminologyData
member.summary:

The terminology data for the custom terminology being imported.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.InputDataConfig
member.summary: The input configuration properties for requesting a batch translation job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.InputDataConfig.ContentType
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ContentType.
Describes the format of the data that you submit to Amazon Translate as input. You can specify one of the following multipurpose internet mail extension (MIME) types:
text/html: The input data consists of one or more HTML files. Amazon Translate translates only the text that resides in the html element in each file.
text/plain: The input data consists of one or more unformatted text files. Amazon Translate translates every character in this type of input.
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.wordprocessingml.document: The input data consists of one or more Word documents (.docx).
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.presentationml.presentation: The input data consists of one or more PowerPoint Presentation files (.pptx).
application/vnd.openxmlformats-officedocument.spreadsheetml.sheet: The input data consists of one or more Excel Workbook files (.xlsx).
If you structure your input data as HTML, ensure that you set this parameter to text/html. By doing so, you cut costs by limiting the translation to the contents of the html element in each file. Otherwise, if you set this parameter to text/plain, your costs will cover the translation of every character.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.InputDataConfig.S3Uri
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property S3Uri.
The URI of the AWS S3 folder that contains the input file. The folder must be in the same Region as the API endpoint you are calling.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataDataLocation.RepositoryType

member.summary:

The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the parallel data resource.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.Description

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.EncryptionKey

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.FailedRecordCount

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.ImportedDataSize
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ImportedDataSize.
The number of UTF-8 characters that Amazon Translate imported from the parallel data input file. This number includes only the characters in your translation examples. It does not include characters that are used to format your file. For example, if you provided a Translation Memory Exchange (.tmx) file, this number does not include the tags.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.ImportedRecordCount
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.LatestUpdateAttemptStatus
member.summary:

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.ParallelDataConfig
member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.SkippedRecordCount
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SkippedRecordCount.
The number of items in the input file that Amazon Translate skipped when you created or updated the parallel data resource. For example, Amazon Translate skips empty records, empty target texts, and empty lines.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.SourceLanguageCode
member.summary:

The source language of the translations in the parallel data file.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.Status
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Status.
The status of the parallel data resource. When the parallel data is ready for you to use, the status is ACTIVE.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.ParallelDataProperties.TargetLanguageCodes
member.summary:

The language codes for the target languages available in the parallel data file. All possible target languages are returned as an array.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StartTextTranslationJob operation. Starts an asynchronous batch translation job. Batch translation jobs can be used to translate large volumes of text across multiple documents at once. For more information, see async.
Batch translation jobs can be described with the DescribeTextTranslationJob operation, listed with the ListTextTranslationJobs operation, and stopped with the StopTextTranslationJob operation.
Amazon Translate does not support batch translation of multiple source languages at once.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.ClientToken
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ClientToken.
A unique identifier for the request. This token is auto-generated when using the Amazon Translate SDK.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.DataAccessRoleArn
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property DataAccessRoleArn.
The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS Identity Access and Management (IAM) role that grants Amazon Translate read access to your input data. For more nformation, see identity-and-access-management.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.InputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property InputDataConfig.
Specifies the format and S3 location of the input documents for the translation job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.JobName
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobName.
The name of the batch translation job to be performed.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.OutputDataConfig
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property OutputDataConfig.
Specifies the S3 folder to which your job output will be saved.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.ParallelDataNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property ParallelDataNames.
The names of the parallel data resources to use in the batch translation job. For a list of available parallel data resources, use the ListParallelData operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.SourceLanguageCode
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property SourceLanguageCode.
The language code of the input language. For a list of language codes, see what-is-languages.
Amazon Translate does not automatically detect a source language during batch translation jobs.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.TargetLanguageCodes
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TargetLanguageCodes.
The language code of the output language.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest.TerminologyNames
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property TerminologyNames.
The name of the terminology to use in the batch translation job. For a list of available terminologies, use the ListTerminologies operation.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StartTextTranslationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The identifier generated for the job. To get the status of a job, use this ID with the DescribeTextTranslationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the job. Possible values include:
SUBMITTED - The job has been received and is queued for processing.
IN_PROGRESS - Amazon Translate is processing the job.
COMPLETED - The job was successfully completed and the output is available.
COMPLETED_WITH_ERROR - The job was completed with errors. The errors can be analyzed in the job's output.
FAILED - The job did not complete. To get details, use the DescribeTextTranslationJob operation.
STOP_REQUESTED - The user who started the job has requested that it be stopped.
STOPPED - The job has been stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the StopTextTranslationJob operation. Stops an asynchronous batch translation job that is in progress.
If the job's state is IN_PROGRESS, the job will be marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the COMPLETED state. Otherwise, the job is put into the STOPPED state.
Asynchronous batch translation jobs are started with the StartTextTranslationJob operation. You can use the DescribeTextTranslationJob or ListTextTranslationJobs operations to get a batch translation job's JobId.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobRequest.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The job ID of the job to be stopped.

member.name: T:Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobResponse
member.summary: This is the response object from the StopTextTranslationJob operation.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobResponse.JobId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobId.
The job ID of the stopped batch translation job.

member.name: P:Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobResponse.JobStatus
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property JobStatus.
The status of the designated job. Upon successful completion, the job's status will be STOPPED.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.AmazonTranslateClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonTranslateClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.AmazonTranslateClient.CreateParallelData(Amazon.Translate.Model.CreateParallelDataRequest)
member.summary: Creates a parallel data resource in Amazon Translate by importing an input file from Amazon S3. Parallel data files contain examples of source phrases and their translations from your translation memory. By adding parallel data, you can influence the style, tone, and word choice in your translation output.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.AmazonTranslateClient.ImportTerminology(Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates a custom terminology, depending on whether or not one already exists for the given terminology name. Importing a terminology with the same name as an existing one will merge the terminologies based on the chosen merge strategy. Currently, the only supported merge strategy is OVERWRITE, and so the imported terminology will overwrite an existing terminology of the same name.
If you import a terminology that overwrites an existing one, the new terminology take up to 10 minutes to fully propagate and be available for use in a translation due to cache policies with the DataPlane service that performs the translations.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ImportTerminology service method.
member.returns: The response from the ImportTerminology service method, as returned by Translate.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.AmazonTranslateClient.StartTextTranslationJob(Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest)
member.summary:
Starts an asynchronous batch translation job. Batch translation jobs can be used to translate large volumes of text across multiple documents at once. For more information, see async.
Batch translation jobs can be described with the DescribeTextTranslationJob operation, listed with the ListTextTranslationJobs operation, and stopped with the StopTextTranslationJob operation.
Amazon Translate does not support batch translation of multiple source languages at once.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StartTextTranslationJob service method.
member.returns: The response from the StartTextTranslationJob service method, as returned by Translate.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.AmazonTranslateClient.StopTextTranslationJob(Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobRequest)
member.summary:
Stops an asynchronous batch translation job that is in progress.
If the job's state is IN_PROGRESS, the job will be marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the COMPLETED state. Otherwise, the job is put into the STOPPED state.
Asynchronous batch translation jobs are started with the StartTextTranslationJob operation. You can use the DescribeTextTranslationJob or ListTextTranslationJobs operations to get a batch translation job's JobId.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StopTextTranslationJob service method.
member.returns: The response from the StopTextTranslationJob service method, as returned by Translate.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.IAmazonTranslate.ImportTerminology(Amazon.Translate.Model.ImportTerminologyRequest)
member.summary:
Creates or updates a custom terminology, depending on whether or not one already exists for the given terminology name. Importing a terminology with the same name as an existing one will merge the terminologies based on the chosen merge strategy. Currently, the only supported merge strategy is OVERWRITE, and so the imported terminology will overwrite an existing terminology of the same name.
If you import a terminology that overwrites an existing one, the new terminology take up to 10 minutes to fully propagate and be available for use in a translation due to cache policies with the DataPlane service that performs the translations.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the ImportTerminology service method.
member.returns: The response from the ImportTerminology service method, as returned by Translate.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.IAmazonTranslate.StartTextTranslationJob(Amazon.Translate.Model.StartTextTranslationJobRequest)
member.summary:
Starts an asynchronous batch translation job. Batch translation jobs can be used to translate large volumes of text across multiple documents at once. For more information, see async.
Batch translation jobs can be described with the DescribeTextTranslationJob operation, listed with the ListTextTranslationJobs operation, and stopped with the StopTextTranslationJob operation.
Amazon Translate does not support batch translation of multiple source languages at once.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StartTextTranslationJob service method.
member.returns: The response from the StartTextTranslationJob service method, as returned by Translate.

member.name: M:Amazon.Translate.IAmazonTranslate.StopTextTranslationJob(Amazon.Translate.Model.StopTextTranslationJobRequest)
member.summary:
Stops an asynchronous batch translation job that is in progress.
If the job's state is IN_PROGRESS, the job will be marked for termination and put into the STOP_REQUESTED state. If the job completes before it can be stopped, it is put into the COMPLETED state. Otherwise, the job is put into the STOPPED state.
Asynchronous batch translation jobs are started with the StartTextTranslationJob operation. You can use the DescribeTextTranslationJob or ListTextTranslationJobs operations to get a batch translation job's JobId.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StopTextTranslationJob service method.
member.returns: The response from the StopTextTranslationJob service method, as returned by Translate.
